Edited August 30, 2013 by mushroomman

(Not my image. Just found it)

That doesn't look right...

That doesn't look right...

It is right. Moho changed in 0.18 to a completely different planet really. Since you joined in June 2013 I don't think you would have seen Moho in 0.17

0.17

0.18

Moho changelog for 0.18:

Entirely changed more cratered surface.

Color changed from red to brown.

No more superheated atmosphere.

No longer tidally locked.

Mass reduced.
RIP cat butt mountain.

It is right. Moho changed in 0.18 to a completely different planet really. Since you joined in June 2013 I don't think you would have seen Moho in 0.17

And, given that fact, maybe you can understand why I wrote what I did...

RIP cat butt mountain.

I'm going to go boot up my old gaming box and see if I bought before or after 0.18...
Very interesting. I didn't buy KSP until after 0.18 came out, but it's always interesting seeing how the game has evolved over time.
mmm. not really what I was expecting. I thought it would look more like http://i.imgur.com/wHePRh.png.

Does anyone care to explain why Moho used to look like an anus? Come on, it's obvious.

I like fenderzilla's screenshot. It would be cool to have such planet in Kerbol system.
No idea. I never got to land in Mt. Cat Butt
i miss the .17 moho

Does anyone care to explain why Moho used to look like an anus? Come on, it's obvious.

Because the devs wanted to make sure that there was no discussion as to what/who the biggest #$$hole in the Kerbal universe is/was?

Because the devs wanted to make sure that there was no discussion as to what/who the biggest #$$hole in the Kerbal universe is/was?

LOL.... That's funny!!!

Does anyone care to explain why Moho used to look like an anus? Come on, it's obvious.

I like fenderzilla's screenshot. It would be cool to have such planet in Kerbol system.

There's a nice fan art pic somewhere of a lander over Moho and Moho is done up like that. I'll see if I can find it.

i miss the .17 moho

I do too. It was a pain to get to, and you're prize for getting there was an almost impossible landing.

I certainly had a devil of a time getting to the surface!

So, wait...

Duna was originally orbiting Jool, Gilly was covered in Crystals and there was an Asteroid called Harvest orbiting Kerbin?

Dude, that's interesting. Go dig up a copy of KSP 1.7 for the sake of Nostalgia.
I miss 0.17 moho. I remember aerobraking there (had to do many passes) And i entered too low and burnt up (The part had low temperature resistance AKA nova's probe core)

Sylandro, what you described was never available to the public, and Harvest wasn't orbiting Kerbin, it had the same orbit AS kerbin.

Also, is this what you mean Captain Sierra:

It's by Rarden, in his Kerbin Art thread. It doesn't look like the original Moho though.
